Lyrics: Je ne puis vivre ainsy toujours
Poetic Translation (CAPL): I can no longer live this way.
Notes: This acrostic poem spells out the name Jaqueline d'Aquevile. (The letters I and J were used interchangeably at this time.)

Lyrics: Au main que j’aye en mes dolours
Quelque confort
Direct Translation: See translation at Choral Public Domain Library

Lyrics: Une seule heure ou mains ou fort
Poetic Translation (CAPL): Union forever, an hour, a day.

Lyrics: Et tou les jours
Leaument serviray amours
Jusqu’a la mort.
Noble femme de nom et d’armes,
Poetic Translation (CAPL): Noble and lofty dame above me,

Lyrics: Escript vous ay ce dittier cy.
Poetic Translation (CAPL): Enter the trance of my ditty.

Lyrics: Des ieux plourant a chauldes larmes
Poetic Translation (CAPL): Drowning in tears, I beg you love me;

Lyrics: Affin qu’ayes de moy merchy.
Poetic Translation (CAPL): Aching for me, give your pity.

Lyrics: Quant a moi, je me meurs boncours
Velant les nuits faisant cent tours
Poetic Translation (CAPL): Under the moon, I pace, I sway;

Lyrics: En criant fort
“Vengence en a Dieu, car a grant tort
Poetic Translation (CAPL): "Vengeance on Heaven! God, tell me why

Lyrics: Je noye en plours”
Lors qu’au besoin me fault secours
Poetic Translation (CAPL): Listen You will not when I pray,

Lyrics: Et Pitie dort.
Je ne puis vivre ainsy toujours
Poetic Translation (CAPL): I can no longer live this way.

Lyrics: Au main que j’aye en mes dolours
Quelque confort
Une seule heure ou mains ou fort
Poetic Translation (CAPL): Union forever, an hour, a day.

Lyrics: Et tou les jours
Leaument serviray amours
Jusqu’a la mort.
Antoine Busnois
